problem.p: Input T for True or F for False for the following statement.
Computing some function in parallel is always faster than computing it serially.
One of the problems of parallelism is that answers may be overwritten in the execution process.
Parallelism is used to speed up proccesses.

div.p: Depending on the task, computing a function serially could be faster and easier than in parallel. For example, assume we are trying to bake a cake. It would make sense to mix preheat the oven, mix the ingredients and then bake. You can see how this could go wrong if these steps happened all at once.
